How to Install the Web Fonts
  • Regular
  • Bold
  • How to Install
1

Copy the folder with the 10 web fonts and the torontosubwayclassic.css stylesheet to your website. You can put the fonts anywhere in your website, but it’s best practice to keep them in a separate folder and to put your CSS stylesheet file in the root directory of your website. All 10 web fonts are required to ensure the fonts will display in as many web browsers as possible.

2

Add a link to the torontosubwayclassic.css stylesheet in your web pages by copying and pasting the following code into the <head> of all of the pages in your website that you want to use the web fonts. 

<link rel="stylesheet" href="torontosubwayclassic.css" type="text/css" charset="utf-8" />
3

Add the new font-family, 'TorontoSubway' to the relevant styles in your stylesheets. Here are a couple of examples:

h1 {
     font-family: 'TorontoSubway', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
     font-weight: bold;
     text-rendering: optimizeLegibility;  /* use kerning for improved letter spacing */
     -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; /* prevent heavy font appearance in Safari */
}
p {
     font-family: 'TorontoSubway', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
     font-weight: normal;
     text-rendering: optimizeLegibility;  /* use kerning for improved letter spacing */
     -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; /* prevent heavy font appearance in Safari */
}

It’s important to have 'TorontoSubway' as the first choice in the font-family selectors. The others are fallbacks.
